required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Effectiveness Study of a New Contact Lens Cleaning and Disinfecting Solution
clinical_study.official_title: A Safety and Effectiveness Study of a New Contact Lens Cleaning and Disinfecting Solution

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of NNR06 Multi-Purpose Solution cleaning and disinfecting solution (Test) compared to COMPLETE Multi-Purpose Solution cleaning and disinfecting solution (Control) when used by habitual contact lens wearers to bilaterally clean and disinfect their contact lenses for approximately three months.

detailed_description.textblock: Approximately 398 subjects (796 eyes) will be enrolled in this three-month controlled, parallel group, masked, randomized study at approximately 22 investigative sites in the United States (US). Approximately one-half of the subjects will be randomized to receive Bausch & Lomb investigational NNR06 Multi-Purpose Solution to be used with a rub care regimen (Test), and approximately one-half of the subjects will be randomized to receive COMPLETE Multi-Purpose Solution with a rub care regimen (Control).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Bausch & Lomb investigational NNR06 Multi-Purpose Solution
arm_group.description: B & L investigational NNR06 used as a rub care regimen (Test)
B&L Multi-Purpose Solution as a rub care regimen (Control)

intervention.description: a multi-purpose solution for disinfecting, cleaning, conditioning, rinsing, protein removal, and storing soft contact lenses including silicone hydrogel lenses.
an experimental solution for disinfecting, cleaning, conditioning, rinsing, protein removal, and storing soft contact lenses including silicone hydrogel lenses.
intervention.arm_group_label: Bausch & Lomb investigational NNR06 Multi-Purpose Solution

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Is a habitual wearer of one of the following lens types:
Lens Group Lens Material Trade Name Manufacturer
4 Etafilcon A Acuvue2 Vistakon
5-A Balafilcon A PureVision2 Bausch + Lomb
5-C Samfilcon A Ultra Bausch + Lomb
5-Cm Lotrafilcon B Optix Aqua Alcon
5-Cr Senofilcon A Oasys Vistakon
- Is correctable through spherocylindrical refraction to 32 letters (0.3 logMAR) or better (distance, high contrast) in each eye with soft spherical contact lenses.
- Has clear central corneas and is free of any anterior segment disorders.
- Is a habitual user of a lens care product for cleaning, disinfecting, and storage of lenses.
- Requires lens correction in both eyes.
- Wears the same manufacturer and brand of lens in both eyes.
- Agrees to wear study lenses on a daily wear basis for approximately three months.
- Is willing and able to comply with all treatment and follow-up/study procedures.
